data.headline: Stocks climb as Supreme Court tariff ruling fuels relief rally in tech and exporters despite weak economic data and lingering trade policy uncertainty
bullets: S&P 500 gained 0.6% and Nasdaq rose 0.8%, while Dow added 0.4% and Russell 2000 slipped 0.2%
Supreme Court's 6–3 decision striking down Trump-era tariffs under IEEPA sparked a relief rally in large-cap tech, exporters, and tariff-exposed retailers/importers
Alphabet jumped ~4% on the day, while Akamai fell 11%, Opendoor surged 19%, and Grail traded sharply lower
Market optimism driven by hopes for $160–175B in tariff refunds to affected companies
Weaker-than-expected Q4 GDP at 1.4%, ~3% PCE inflation linked to the shutdown, and soft ISM PMIs were overshadowed by tariff relief
Oil prices rose modestly on US-Iran tensions, supporting energy stocks
Traders remain focused on trade policy uncertainty, potential refund litigation, upcoming housing data, and policy responses as key volatility drivers
